alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 3:35AM PST until February 25 at 5:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 733 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside, San Bernardino and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 733 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated a band of heavy rain slowly moving east through the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, Moreno Valley, Oceanside, Carlsbad, Temecula, El Cajon, Vista, Redlands, San Clemente and Encinitas. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
